schema.description: This message contains information about the status of the tile upload buffer.

queue_length.description: The number of tiles currently stored and waiting to be uploaded.
queue_length.title: Queue Length

free_space.description: The amount of free space on the tile storage disk in bytes.
free_space.title: Free Space

upload_rate.description: The rate at which data is being uploaded in bits per second.
upload_rate.title: Upload Rate

schema.title: Status

schema.description: This message is used to instruct the camera to capture an image.

montage_id.description: The montage ID. If a zero length string, the tile is for UI display or calibration purposes only.
montage_id.title: Montage Id

row.description: The row of the montage where the tile was captured.
row.title: Row

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.
column.title: Column

overlap.description: The number of pixels of overlap between tiles.
overlap.title: Overlap

brightfield.description: If true, this tile should be used in creating the brightfield image.
brightfield.title: Brightfield

darkfield.description: If true, this tile should be used in creating the darkfield image.
darkfield.title: Darkfield

lens_correction.description: If true, this tile is part of a lens correction montage.
lens_correction.title: Lens Correction

schema.title: Command

schema.description: This message is sent after the camera exposure is complete.

montage_id.description: The montage ID. If a zero length string, the tile is for UI display or calibration purposes only.
montage_id.title: Montage Id

schema.title: Image

schema.description: This message is used to change camera settings.

exposure.description: The length of the camera exposure in microseconds.
exposure.title: Exposure

width.description: The width of the camera frame.
width.title: Width

height.description: The height of the camera frame.
height.title: Height

schema.title: Settings

schema.description: This message contains information about the state of the camera.

exposure.description: The length of the camera exposure in microseconds.
exposure.title: Exposure

target_temp.description: The target temperature of the camera cooling system.
target_temp.title: Target Temp

bit_depth.description: The bit depth of the camera sensor.
bit_depth.title: Bit Depth

schema.title: Status

schema.description: This message is used to change microscope settings.

focus.description: The desired focus value for the microscope, or None to keep the current value.
focus.title: Focus

mag_mode.description: The desired magnification mode for the microscope, or None to keep the current value.
mag_mode.title: Mag Mode

mag.description: The desired magnification for the microscope, or None to keep the current value.
mag.title: Mag

brightness.description: The desired beam spread for the microscope, or None to keep the current value.
brightness.title: Brightness

beam_offset.description: The desired beam shift values, or None to keep the current value.
beam_offset.title: Beam Offset

spot_size.description: The desired spot size, or None to keep the current value.
spot_size.title: Spot Size

screen.description: "up" to raise the microscope viewscreen, "down" to lower the microscope viewscreen, or None to keep the viewscreen in the current position.
screen.title: Screen

schema.title: Command

schema.description: This message contains the state of the microscope.

aperture.description: The current status of the objective aperture, or None if unknown.
aperture.title: Aperture

tank_voltage.description: The current voltage of the tank in kilo-volts.
tank_voltage.title: Tank Voltage

screen.description: Whether the viewscreen is currently "up", "down", or None for an unknown position.
screen.title: Screen

schema.title: Status

schema.description: This message conatins the status of the image shifting system.

enabled.description: If the image shifting system is currently enabled.
enabled.title: Enabled

current_position.description: The current position index, or None if disabled.
current_position.title: Current Position

image_shift.description: The current image shift calibration values.
image_shift.title: Image Shift

calibration.description: The calibration values for each position index.
calibration.title: Calibration

schema.title: Status

schema.description: This message is used to enable and disable the image shifting system, and to switch to a predefined position.

enable.description: Used to enable and disable the image shifting system.
enable.title: Enable

position.description: The calibrated position index to use, or None if disabled.
position.title: Position

schema.title: Command

schema.description: This message is used to calibrate the image shifting system.

position.description: The image shift position index to calibrate.
position.title: Position

image_shift.description: The new calibration values for this position index.
image_shift.title: Image Shift

schema.title: Calibrate

schema.description: This message is uesd to change between apertures on a substrate.

aperture_id.description: The ID of the aperture to change to, or None to remain at the current aperture.
aperture_id.title: Aperture Id

calibrate.description: Set to True to initiate aperture changing hardware calibration.
calibrate.title: Calibrate

schema.title: Command

schema.description: This message includes status information about the aperture changing system.

current_aperture.description: The ID of the current aperture, or None if unknown.
current_aperture.title: Current Aperture

calibrated.description: True if the aperture changing hardware is calibrated.
calibrated.title: Calibrated

schema.title: Status

schema.description: This message is used to specify how the stage should move the sample.

x.description: The desired absolute X position of the stage in nanometers, or None to keep the current position.
x.title: X

y.description: The desired absolute Y position of the stage in nanometers, or None to keep the current position.
y.title: Y

z.description: The desired absolute Z position of the stage in nanometers, or None to keep the current position.
z.title: Z

calibrate.description: Set to True to initiate stage calibration.
calibrate.title: Calibrate

schema.title: Command

schema.description: This message includes stage motion status information.

x.description: The current X position of the stage in nanometers, or None if unknown.
x.title: X

y.description: The current Y position of the stage in nanometers, or None if unknown.
y.title: Y

z.description: The current Z position of the stage in nanometers, or None if unknown.
z.title: Z

in_motion.description: This value is True if the stage is currently moving.
in_motion.title: In Motion

calibrated.description: True if the stage is calibrated.
calibrated.title: Calibrated

schema.title: Status

schema.description: This message is used to rotate the sample, and to calibrate this rotation.

angle_x.description: The desired rotation angle around the X axis in radians, or None to keep the current value.
angle_x.title: Angle X

angle_y.description: The desired rotation angle around the Y axis in radians, or None to keep the current value.
angle_y.title: Angle Y

eucentric_height.description: The eucentric height of the stage in nanometers for calibration, or None to keep the current value.
eucentric_height.title: Eucentric Height

calibrate.description: If True, calibrate the sample rotation hardware.
calibrate.title: Calibrate

schema.title: Command

schema.description: This message contains the status of the sample rotation system.

angle_x.description: The current angle around the X axis in radians.
angle_x.title: Angle X

angle_y.description: The current angle around the Y axis in radians.
angle_y.title: Angle Y

eucentric_height.description: The current enucentric height value in nanometers.
eucentric_height.title: Eucentric Height

in_motion.description: True if the rotation stage is currently moving.
in_motion.title: In Motion

schema.title: Status

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.

overlap.title: Overlap

image.description: The downsampled tile as a base 64 encoded string.

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.

row.description: The row of the montage where the tile was captured.

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.

schema.description: This message contains the focus score, a measure of the quality of the focus of a given tile.

montage_id.title: Montage Id

row.description: The row of the montage where the tile was captured.
row.title: Row

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.
column.title: Column

overlap.description: The number of pixels of overlap between tiles.
overlap.title: Overlap

focus.description: The focus metric. Lower is better
focus.title: Focus

schema.description: This message contains raw histogram data for a tile.

montage_id.title: Montage Id

row.description: The row of the montage where the tile was captured.
row.title: Row

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.
column.title: Column

overlap.description: The number of pixels of overlap between tiles.
overlap.title: Overlap

schema.description: This message contains simple statistics about a processed tile.

montage_id.description: The montage ID. If a zero length string, the tile is for UI display or calibration purposes only.
montage_id.title: Montage Id

row.description: The row of the montage where the tile was captured.
row.title: Row

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.
column.title: Column

overlap.description: The number of pixels of overlap between tiles.
overlap.title: Overlap

std.description: The standard deviation of the pixel values.
std.title: Std

schema.title: MinMaxMean

row.description: The row of the neighboring tile.
row.title: Row

column.description: The column of the neighboring tile.
column.title: Column

dX.description: The X axis offset of the tile in pixels to get the tile to match.
dX.title: Dx

dY.description: The Y axis offset of the tile in pixels to get the tile to match.
dY.title: Dy

dXsd.description: The X axis offset standard deviation of all the feature matches.
dXsd.title: Dxsd

dYsd.description: The Y axis offset standard deviation of all the feature matches.
dYsd.title: Dysd

distance.description: The euclidian offset distance in pixels.
distance.title: Distance

rotation.description: The tile rotation in radians necessary to get the tiles to match.

position.description: The position of matched tile relative to the captured tile.
position.title: Position

pX.description: The captured tile feature X positions.

pY.description: The captured tile feature Y positions.
pY.title: Py

qX.description: The matched tile feature X positions.
qX.title: Qx

qY.description: The matched tile feature Y positions.
qY.title: Qy

schema.description: This message contains data relating to the matching of neighboring tiles.

montage_id.description: The montage ID. If a zero length string, the tile is for UI display or calibration purposes only.
montage_id.title: Montage Id

row.description: The row of the montage where the tile was captured.
row.title: Row

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.
column.title: Column

overlap.description: The number of pixels of overlap between tiles.
overlap.title: Overlap

matches.description: Information about how the captured tile matches to each of its available neighbors.
matches.title: Matches

schema.title: Matches

row.description: The row of the neighboring tile.
row.title: Row

column.description: The column of the neighboring tile.
column.title: Column

position.description: The position of matched tile relative to the captured tile.
position.title: Position

offsets.description: The offsets between expected and actual template positions.
offsets.title: Offsets

maxVal.description: The maximum value from each of the template matches.
maxVal.title: Maxval

minVal.description: The minimum value from each of the template matches.
minVal.title: Minval

maxLoc.description: The maximum location of each template match.
maxLoc.title: Maxloc

matched_pos_img2.description: Each of the template top left corner absolute locations.
matched_pos_img2.title: Matched Pos Img2

matched_center_img2.description: Each of the template center absolute locations.
matched_center_img2.title: Matched Center Img2

good.description: True if an individual match is good.
good.title: Good

reject_reason.description: The reason why an individual match is not good.
reject_reason.title: Reject Reason

schema.description: This message contains data reltaing to template matches used for calculating the lens correction transform.

montage_id.description: The montage ID. If a zero length string, the tile is for UI display or calibration purposes only.
montage_id.title: Montage Id

row.description: The row of the montage where the tile was captured.

column.description: The column of the montage where the tile was captured.
column.title: Column

overlap.description: The number of pixels of overlap between tiles.
overlap.title: Overlap

matches.description: Information about how the captured tile matches to each of its available neighbors.
matches.title: Matches

schema.title: TemplateMatches

schema.description: This message is used to edit existing ROIs in the ROI queue.

roi_pos_x.description: The new X position of the ROI in nanometers.
roi_pos_x.title: Roi Pos X

roi_pox_y.description: The new Y position of the ROI in nanometers.
roi_pox_y.title: Roi Pox Y

roi_width.description: The new width of the ROI in nanometers.
roi_width.title: Roi Width

roi_height.description: The new height of the ROI in nanometers.
roi_height.title: Roi Height

roi_angle.description: The new angle to rotate the ROI in radians.
roi_angle.title: Roi Angle

schema.title: Edit

schema.description: This message is used start and stop automated image acquisition.

montage.description: Begin collecting montages according to the ROI queue.
montage.title: Montage

abort_at_end.description: Stop imaging after the current montage is complete.
abort_at_end.title: Abort At End

cancel.description: Return to preview mode from a failure state.
cancel.title: Cancel

schema.title: Run

schema.description: This message is utilized to setup a microscope in a semi-automated manner. Each of the fields in this message instructs the system to run an individual setup routine.

lens_correction.description: Collect and generate a lens correction.
lens_correction.title: Lens Correction

center_beam.description: Center the beam in the image frame.
center_beam.title: Center Beam

find_aperture.description: Find and move to the aperture centroid.
find_aperture.title: Find Aperture

calibrate_resolution.description: Calibrate the resolution of the microscope at the current mag level.
calibrate_resolution.title: Calibrate Resolution

mag_mode.description: Change to the specified mag mode. The "mag" field must also be specified.
mag_mode.title: Mag Mode

mag.description: Change to the specified magnification. "mga_mode" must also be specified.
mag.title: Mag

schema.title: Setup

raster_index.description: The index of the tile incremented for each subsequent tile in the montage.
raster_index.title: Raster Index

stage_position.description: The X-Y stage position of the tile in nanometers.
stage_position.title: Stage Position

raster_position.description: The X-Y indicies of the tile in the montage.
raster_position.title: Raster Position

schema.description: This message is sent after a montage is completed.

tiles.description: A mapping from tile IDs to tile metadata.
tiles.title: Tiles

start_time.description: The timestamp when the montage was started.
start_time.title: Start Time

rotation_angle.description: The necessary tile rotation in radians to line up the right-handed image coordinate system with the Stage x-y coordinate system.
rotation_angle.title: Rotation Angle

aperture_centroid.description: The X-Y coordinates of the centroid of the imaged aperture in nanometers.
aperture_centroid.title: Aperture Centroid

schema.title: Complete

schema.description: This message contains the overall QC status of the system.

status.description: The QC status, "GOOD" if imaging should continue, "STOP_AT_END" if imaging should be stopped at the end of the current montage, and "STOP_NOW" if imaging should be stopped immediately.
status.title: Status

reason.description: Optionally, a human readable reason for the current status.
reason.title: Reason

schema.title: Status

schema.description: This message can be used to load an ROI from the database into the ROI queue.

specimen_id.description: The specimen ID to load from the database.
specimen_id.title: Specimen Id

section_id.description: The section ID to load from the database.
section_id.title: Section Id

grid_id.description: The the grid ID where the section is loaded.
grid_id.title: Grid Id

queue_position.description: Position in queue, None means set as current
queue_position.title: Queue Position

schema.title: LoadROI

schema.description: This message can be used to create an ROI and add it to the ROI queue.

vertices.description: A list of points defining a polygonal ROI.
vertices.title: Vertices

rotation_angle.description: The rotation angle of the ROI in radians.
rotation_angle.title: Rotation Angle

buffer_size.description: The amount to dialate the ROI in nanometers when imaging.
buffer_size.title: Buffer Size

montage_id.description: The montage ID to use when imaging the ROI.
montage_id.title: Montage Id

specimen_id.description: The specimen ID corresponding to this ROI.
specimen_id.title: Specimen Id

grid_id.description: The grid ID where this ROI should be imaged.
grid_id.title: Grid Id

section_id.description: The section ID corresponding to this ROI.
section_id.title: Section Id

queue_position.description: Position in queue, None means set as current
queue_position.title: Queue Position

center.description: The center point of the ROI.

tilt_angles.description: List of tilt angles in degrees for tomography series
tilt_angles.title: Tilt Angles

overview_nm_per_pixel.description: Overview image scale in nm per pixel
overview_nm_per_pixel.title: Overview Nm Per Pixel

schema.title: CreateROI

schema.description: Information about the current ROI being imaged.

vertices.description: A list of points defining a polygonal ROI.
vertices.title: Vertices

rotation_angle.description: The rotation angle of the ROI in radians.
rotation_angle.title: Rotation Angle

buffer_size.description: The amount to dialate the ROI in nanometers when imaging.
buffer_size.title: Buffer Size

montage_id.description: The montage ID to use when imaging the ROI.
montage_id.title: Montage Id

specimen_id.description: The specimen ID corresponding to this ROI.
specimen_id.title: Specimen Id

grid_id.description: The grid ID where this ROI should be imaged.
grid_id.title: Grid Id

section_id.description: The section ID corresponding to this ROI.
section_id.title: Section Id

queue_position.description: Position in queue, None means set as current
queue_position.title: Queue Position

schema.title: ROI

schema.description: This message contains information on the status of an individual ROI.

type.description: Event type: roi_added, roi_advanced, queue_cleared, queue_empty
type.title: Type

roi_count.description: Total number of active ROIs (queue + current)
roi_count.title: Roi Count

has_active_rois.description: Whether there are any ROIs available
has_active_rois.title: Has Active Rois

source.description: Source of last ROI submission: UI or external
source.title: Source

schema.title: ROIStatus

image.description: The map as a base 64 encoded image.
image.title: Image

colorbar.description: The colorbar as a base 64 encoded image.
colorbar.title: Colorbar

min.description: The minimum value of the colorbar.
min.title: Min

max.description: The maximum value of the colorbar.
max.title: Max

schema.description: This message contains multiple overview maps including a low resolution version of the montage, along with various statistics.
schema.title: Minimaps

nm_per_px.description: The X-Y size of each pixel in the processed camera image in nanometers.
nm_per_px.title: Nm Per Px

rotation.description: The rotation required to match a right-handed image coordinate system to the coordinate system of the stage in radians.
rotation.title: Rotation

schema.description: This message contains the resolutions of all the calibrated magnifications of the microscope.

lowmag.description: A mapping of calibrated low-mag magnifications to thier calibration values.
lowmag.title: Lowmag

mag.description: A mapping of calibrated high-mag magnifications to their calibration values.
mag.title: Mag

schema.title: Resolution

schema.description: This message contains the location of the centroid of the specified aperture.

aperture_id.description: The ID of the aperture that this centroid pertains to.
aperture_id.title: Aperture Id

x.description: The stage coordinate system X axis location of the centroid.
x.title: X

y.description: The stage coordinate system Y axis location of the centroid.
y.title: Y

schema.title: Centroid

schema.description: This message contains the current state of the orchastration state machine.

state.description: The current state of the orchastration state machine.
state.title: State

schema.title: Current

schema.description: This message is sent on a state change of the orchastration state machine.

old.description: The previous state of the orchastration state machine.

new.description: The new state of the orchastration state machine.
new.title: New

schema.title: Change

schema.description: This message contains a compact representation of the generated lens correction transform.

transform.description: The base64 encoded lens correction transform.
